meanings.sent1: His inglorious behavior at the party embarrassed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's inglorious actions led to his arrest.
meanings.sent3: It was quite inglorious of him to spill juice all over himself.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the historic building was an inglorious act of vandalism.
meanings.sent5: The defeat in the final match was an inglorious end to their season.

meanings.sent1: The small town remained inglorious despite its beauty.
meanings.sent2: Her inglorious past allowed her to live a quiet life.
meanings.sent3: The inglorious singer performed at the local fair.
meanings.sent4: The inglorious author's book never gained much attention.
meanings.sent5: The inglorious actor was content with his small roles.

meanings.sent1: The soldier's inglorious retreat disappointed his comrades.
meanings.sent2: The inglorious defeat left a bitter taste in their mouths.
meanings.sent3: It was an inglorious moment when he tripped on stage.
meanings.sent4: The inglorious decision to cheat cost him his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The inglorious end of the battle marked a dark chapter in history.
